body:
There are two methods to bootstrap clingo: from official pre-built binaries & by building from sources. They are called: github-actions and spack-install respectively.

Both names are questionable: "github-actions" is an implementation detail? "spack-install" does not imply "from sources".

This PR fixes the names and adds automated config updates.

Edit: I just realized that maybe I got `spack-install` wrong, but I would hope that that option forces a build from sources instead of checking a binary mirror? Or not @alalazo?
title: Rename github-actions => official-spack-binaries, spack-install => build-from-sources
